excerpt: Longtime destination for food & medicinal herbs sold in historic buildings & an open-air market.
detail_description: Begin your day in Belem with a visit to the iconic Mercado Ver-o-Peso, where you'll find an impressive variety of products from the Amazon rainforest and rivers. The market is a vibrant mosaic of colors, aromas, and flavors that are characteristic of the Para region. Explore historic buildings and an open-air market selling food and medicinal herbs. Your guide will introduce you to local vendors and share interesting insights about regional produce like cassava leaves and tucupi juice.
name: Mercado Ver-o-Peso
address: Blvd. Castilhos França - Campina, Belém - PA, 66013-030, Brazil

excerpt: Converted dock warehouses offering trendy eateries, shops, bars & live cultural events.
detail_description: Estação das Docas, located in Belém, is a renovated complex of 19th-century steel cargo warehouses that have been transformed into a modern hub for dining, shopping, and cultural experiences. The airy and trendy space houses boutiques, bookstores, bars, cafes, gourmet restaurants, art galleries, a theater, and a cinema. With large glass walls offering views of the docks and the river, it has become one of the city's most popular hangout spots.
name: Estação das Docas
address: Av. Mal. Hermes, S/N - Campina, Belém - PA, 66010-020, Brazil

excerpt: Extensive landscaped gardens with a riverside observation tower & ponds home to flamingos & herons.
detail_description: Mangal das Garças is a breathtaking park nestled in the heart of Belem's Cidade Velha, just behind the Navy Arsenal. This urban oasis boasts beautifully landscaped gardens that feature serene ponds and an observation tower overlooking the Rio Guama. Visitors can marvel at a variety of indigenous birds, including flamingos and herons, while strolling along modern boardwalks and enjoying picturesque views across the river.
name: Mangal das Garças
address: R. Carneiro da Rocha, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-160, Brazil

detail_description: Theatro da Paz, or Peace Theatre, is a renowned neoclassical-style theater located in Belem, Para, Brazil. Built between 1869 and 1874 during the Para rubber boom, it features a beautiful facade with imposing stone columns and Italianate finishings. The interior boasts precious woods, gilt mirrors, crystal chandeliers, and glossy Italian marble.
name: Theatro da Paz
address: Avenida da Paz, Praça da República, S/N - Campina, Belém - PA, 66017-060, Brazil

excerpt: Belém, capital of the state of Pará, is a port city and gateway to Brazil’s lower Amazon region. By Guajará Bay, the riverfront district Cidade Velha (old town) preserves Portuguese-colonial architecture, including churches, colorful azulejo-tile houses and a 17th-century fortification known as Forte do Presépio. Ver-o-Peso is a vast, open-air market on the water selling Amazonian fish, fruit and handicrafts.
detail_description: Belém, the capital of Pará, is a vibrant port city that serves as the gateway to Brazil's lower Amazon region. The riverfront district of Cidade Velha boasts well-preserved Portuguese-colonial architecture, including churches and colorful azulejo-tile houses. The 17th-century Forte do Presépio stands as a testament to the city's history.
name: Belém
address: State of Pará, Brazil

name: Feliz Lusitânia-Complex
address: R. Siqueira Mendes, 2-240 - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-600, Brazil

excerpt: Venerable research institution & museum with a zoological & botanical park, plus artifact exhibits.
detail_description: Zoobotanical Park - Emílio Goeldi Museum is a renowned research institution and museum located in Belem, Para, Brazil. Established in the mid-1860s, it forms part of the Parque Zoobotanico complex and has become a significant research facility. The museum showcases Indian artifacts such as vibrant 'Marajoara' pottery crafted by the indigenous Marajo Indians. However, its main attractions are the Brazilian animals and zoo gardens, particularly the monkeys.
name: Zoobotanical Park - Emílio Goeldi Museum
address: Av. Gov Magalhães Barata, 376 - São Braz, Belém - PA, 66040-170, Brazil

excerpt: Sprawling urban botanical garden & nature preserve featuring abundant flora & fauna.
detail_description: Bosque Rodrigues Alves - Amazon Zoobotanical Garden, located in Belem, Para, Brazil, is one of the oldest botanical gardens in the country. Spanning 40 acres, it houses diverse collections of flora including cacti, succulent plants, orchids, coniferous trees and medicinal plants. The garden also features lakes, waterfalls, caves and a small zoo with turtles. Visitors can experience the Amazon rainforest firsthand within the city at this urban nature preserve.
name: Bosque Rodrigues Alves - Amazon Zoobotanical Garden
address: Av. Alm. Barroso, 2305 - Marco, Belém - PA, 66093-034, Brazil

detail_description: If you're seeking a delightful day trip, look no further than Ilha do Combu, an enchanting island nestled in the Guama River. Just a short boat ride from the city, this lush paradise is celebrated for its rich cacao and acai production. Upon arrival, make your way to Dona Nena's chocolate factory where you can immerse yourself in the fascinating process of chocolate-making using locally sourced cacao. Indulge in free samples and discover unique products to take home.
name: Ilha do Cumb
address: Outeiro, Belém - State of Pará, Brazil

detail_description: Cultural Center Casa das Onze Janelas is a captivating art museum located on the banks of the Guama River in Belem. It features a diverse collection of classical and modern art, including paintings, sculptures, and photography. The center was originally a house owned by a Sugar Baron and later served as a military hospital before being transformed into an art museum. Visitors can also enjoy dining at Saulo's restaurant within the complex.
name: Cultural Center Casa das Onze Janelas
address: R. Siqueira Mendes - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-600, Brazil

excerpt: Neoclassical basilica built in 1909, with ornate stained-glass windows & glittering mosaics.
detail_description: The Basilica Sanctuary of Our Lady of Nazareth, a stunning neoclassical masterpiece completed in 1909, is an architectural gem that captivates visitors with its grandeur. Nestled in the heart of Belém, Brazil, this basilica features intricate stained-glass windows and dazzling mosaics that adorn its opulent interior crafted entirely from European marble.
name: Basilica Sanctuary of Our Lady of Nazareth
address: Av. Nª Sra. de Nazaré, 1300 - Nazaré, Belém - PA, 66035-145, Brazil

excerpt: Leafy space with a monument to a coup of 1889, ornate colonial-era buildings & a Sunday craft fair.
detail_description: Praça da República is a charming leafy square in the heart of Belem, featuring a monument to the republic and ornate colonial-era buildings. The wide triangle-shaped park is shaded by mango trees and tall bamboos, offering a peaceful retreat from the sun. Visitors can stroll through the historic green space, admire the iconic Teatro da Paz, and explore a Sunday craft fair showcasing local goods.
name: Praça da República
address: Av. Pres. Vargas, 814 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66017-060, Brazil

detail_description: Praça Batista Campos is a popular park in Belem that attracts crowds day and night. The park features charming bridges over canals, lush trees, and vendors selling snacks like popcorn and coconuts. Visitors of all ages can be seen enjoying the park's amenities, including benches and a beautiful gazebo at its center. Families come to play with their kids, walk their dogs, or exercise in this safe outdoor space.
name: Praça Batista Campos
address: Tv. Padre Eutíquio, S/N - Batista Campos, Belém - PA, 68447-000, Brazil

excerpt: Creative hub with Belém craft, fashion & jewelry stores & stalls in a restored 18th century convent.
detail_description: São José Liberto - Cultural Center and Gems Museum is a vibrant cultural hub nestled in a beautifully restored 18th-century Franciscan monastery. This unique venue showcases the rich artistic heritage of Belém, featuring an array of craft, fashion, and jewelry stores that reflect local talent. The Gems Museum within this complex offers an intriguing journey through the gemological history of Pará, boasting over 4,000 pieces including ancient amulets and stunning natural artifacts like fossilized stems.
name: São José Liberto - Cultural Center and Gems Museum
address: Praça Amazonas, s/n - Jurunas, Belém - PA, 66025-070, Brazil

excerpt: Former governors home open to the public with a theater & an ice cream shop inside an old train car.
detail_description: Parque da Residência is a captivating destination that invites visitors to explore its rich history and vibrant atmosphere. Once the official residence of the governor of Pará, this park now serves as a cultural hub, housing the Secretaria de Cultura and offering public spaces for everyone to enjoy.
name: Parque da Residência
address: Av. Gov Magalhães Barata, 830 - São Brás, Belém - PA, 66063-240, Brazil

excerpt: Wooden concert hall on a lake, with a boardwalk edging the river & food stalls selling local bites.
detail_description: Ver-o-Rio is a charming wooden concert hall located on the banks of the Guama River in Belem. The area, known as THE Docks station, has been transformed from old warehouses into a vibrant tourist complex featuring cultural events and an array of dining options including restaurants, snack bars, breweries, and ice cream parlors. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls or bike rides along the boardwalk while taking in stunning views of the river.
name: Ver-o-Rio
address: Av. Mal. Hermes, 1374 - Umarizal, Belém - PA, 66645-745, Brazil

excerpt: Urban lakefront recreational hub with sprawling green space & bicycling & walking trails.
detail_description: Utinga State Park is a stunning urban oasis that spans over 1,300 hectares, offering a delightful escape into nature right in the heart of Belém. This park serves as both a recreational hub and an essential water source for the city, making it a vital part of the local ecosystem. Visitors can explore its extensive network of walking and biking trails that meander around Lake Agua Preta, providing breathtaking views and opportunities to connect with diverse wildlife.
name: Utinga State Park
address: Av. João Paulo II, S/N - Curió-Utinga, Belém - PA, 66610-770, Brazil

excerpt: Imposing waterfront fortress constructed in 1616, now housing a museum on native indigenous culture.
detail_description: Presépio Fort, a waterfront fortress built in 1616, served as an observation station against native Indian attacks and invasions. It underwent several renovations and now houses a museum showcasing indigenous culture and colonial history. Restored in the 1980s, it offers panoramic views of the city and features artifacts from the indigenous past. Despite its small size, visitors can explore its rich history and enjoy stunning harbor views at an affordable cost.
name: Presépio Fort
address: Praça Dom Frei Caetano Brandão, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-600, Brazil

detail_description: Cemitério de Nossa Senhora da Soledade, also known as the Memorial Park, is a significant cultural site in Belém, Brazil. It holds historical value and serves as a reminder of Amazonian traditions and navigation. This park is situated close to other notable attractions such as Mangal das Garcas and the Seringal Park Museum.
name: Cemetery Park of Soledade
address: Av. Serzedelo Corrêa, 514 - Batista Campos, Belém - PA, 66033-265, Brazil

detail_description: The Círio Museum, located in Belem, Para, Brazil, offers a deep dive into the city's famous annual Cirio of Nazare religious celebration and procession. The exhibits are housed in two spacious rooms and provide insights into the origins and significance of this grand event that draws nearly a million participants every second Saturday of October. Visitors can take guided tours lasting 20 to 30 minutes to explore themed areas that delve into the religiosity of Cirio as well as the concurrent worldly festivals.
name: Círio Museum
address: R. Padre Champagnat, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-310, Brazil

detail_description: The museum Corveta-Museu Solimões offers an impressive and significant experience. This attraction holds historical significance for the region, showcasing a boat that played a vital role in helping numerous individuals. The sight of this vessel is truly moving, evoking emotions as one reflects on its past contributions. Visitors are guided through the journey by an amiable sailor who possesses extensive knowledge about the ship.
name: Corveta-Museu Solimões
address: R. Siqueira Mendes, 252 - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-600, Brazil

excerpt: Grand, 18th-century Catholic church featuring a dramatic interior filled with elaborate frescoes.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Belem, Our Lady of Grace Cathedral stands as a stunning example of 18th-century architecture and artistry. This grand Catholic church captivates visitors with its beautifully restored facade and interior, adorned with intricate frescoes that tell emotional stories. The dimly lit walls contrast beautifully with the pristine white ceiling embellished with azure paintings, creating an aesthetically pleasing atmosphere.
name: Our Lady of Grace Cathedral
address: Praça Dom Frei Caetano Brandão - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-310, Brazil

detail_description: The CCBEU - Brazil United States Cultural Center is a great place to study and research since it has a lot of resources and is very comfortable. It's also the best time champion!
name: CCBEU - Brazil United States Cultural Center
address: Tv. Padre Eutíquio, 1309 - Batista Campos, Belém - PA, 66023-710, Brazil

detail_description: The museum Palacete Bolonha is a remarkably exquisite and mesmerizing historical edifice located in Belem. Its construction was commissioned by the Duck as an expression of his deep love for his cherished spouse in days gone by. The palace boasts impeccable intricacies and flawlessness, rendering it truly breathtaking to behold. A visit to this exceptional landmark is highly recommended when exploring Belem.
name: Palacete Bolonha
address: Av. Gov. José Malcher, 295 - Nazaré, Belém - PA, 66035-065, Brazil

detail_description: Palácio Antônio Lemos, originally a rubber-boom palace and later used as city hall, now hosts the Museu de Arte de Belém on its second floor. The museum features stunning wooden floors and provides cloth slippers for visitors to wear while exploring its fine collection of beautiful works that offer insights into the city and its people. It's definitely worth a visit to experience the cultural richness it has to offer.
name: Museum of Art of Belém
address: Praça Dom Pedro II, 2 - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-240, Brazil

detail_description: The Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, situated in the Historic Center of Belem, is a remarkable Catholic church that dates back to the 18th century. This architectural masterpiece, with its notable involvement from architect Antonio Landi, has recently undergone restoration, showcasing its captivating arches and stunning architectural beauty. It stands as an incredible testament to history and serves as a prominent landmark within the city.
name: Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel
address: Tv. Dom Bôsco, 69-109 - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-210, Brazil

detail_description: The Pará State Museum, located in the historic Palacio Lauro Sodre, has a rich history as the former residence of Portugal's royal representatives and state governors. The palace witnessed significant events such as the Cabanagem Rebellion, during which Governor Ernest Lobo was tragically killed on its stairs. This free museum offers an insightful look into the region's past. However, visitors should be mindful of its opening hours to ensure a smooth visit.
name: Pará State Museum
address: Praça Dom Pedro II, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-240, Brazil

detail_description: The Estádio Olímpico do Pará - Jornalista Edgar Proença (Mangueirão) is a renowned stadium located in Belém, Brazil. This impressive sports venue holds a significant place in the region's history and has witnessed countless memorable moments over the years. The architectural design of this stadium is remarkable, showcasing modern infrastructure and facilities that ensure an enjoyable experience for both athletes and spectators alike.
name: Pará Olympic Stadium (Mangueirão)
address: Rod. Augusto Montenegro, s/n - Km 03 - Mangueirão, Belém - PA, 66640-000, Brazil

detail_description: The SESC Boulevard Cultural Center is a cultural center that opened in February 2019. It is located on SESC Boulevard, close to the Praça da Bandeira and the Expo 2020 site. The center houses a library, a cinema, and art galleries.
name: SESC Boulevard Cultural Center
address: Blvd. Castilhos França, 522/523 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66010-020, Brazil

name: Estádio Banpará Curuzu
address: Av. Alm. Barroso, 654 - Marco, Belém - PA, 66093-971, Brazil

detail_description: The Theater Margarida Schivasappa is a theater in at least 300 characters. It is known for its professional and high-quality performances.
name: Theater Margarida Schivasappa
address: Av. Gentil Bitencourt, 650 - Batista Campos, Belém - PA, 66035-340, Brazil

detail_description: The Experimental Theatre Waldemar Henrique is a neoclassical theater with a capacity of 220 people. It features wood and leather armchairs, as well as stands with seating. The theater has a versatile space for performances and includes dressing rooms, an iron structure, and power facilities. Inspired by the Sacalla Theater in Milan, it boasts European decorations such as a French chandelier, bronze statues, Portuguese stone floor, and Italian marble staircase.
name: Experimental Theatre Waldemar Henrique
address: Av. Pres. Vargas, 645 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66017-000, Brazil

name: Praia do Cruzeiro
address: Tv. do Cruzeiro, 463-645 - Cruzeiro, Belém - PA, 66810-010, Brazil

detail_description: It is difficult to imagine anyone desiring to depart from this stunning shoreline. The scenery is breathtaking, the inhabitants of the lodging establishments are highly hospitable, and the cuisine is superb. This locale can be described as a charming haven situated on the picturesque Cortijuba Island. It comes with a strong recommendation for individuals in proximity to visit here.
name: Praia Vai Quem Quer, Ilha de Cotijuba
address: Praia Vai Quem Quer - Ilha de Cotijuba, Outeiro, Belém - PA, 66846-220, Brazil

detail_description: The Theodoro Braga gallery consistently showcases stunning and highly engaging exhibitions. It comes highly recommended as a must-visit destination. Additionally, visitors are sometimes treated to conversations with the talented artists themselves. This art gallery in Belem do Para is renowned for its contemporary art, making it a prominent and influential cultural hub not only within the northern region of Brazil but also on an international scale.
name: Galeria Theodoro Braga
address: Batista Campos, Belém - PA, 66035-444, Brazil

detail_description: The art gallery Gotazkaen is a trendy establishment that consistently accommodates our preferences and fulfills our desires in one location. The prices are reasonable for both the delectable cuisine and affordable beer options. Although it does not have a permanent location, it periodically changes venues but always returns with great offerings. The gallery holds significant reverence among residents of Belem.
name: Gotazkaen
address: R. Caetano Rufino, 84 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66015-070, Brazil

name: Teatro do Sesi
address: Marco, Belém - PA, 68447-000, Brazil

detail_description: Vila Container, a cultural center located in the heart of Belem, embraces an innovative concept by repurposing old containers into a vibrant space housing various stores and food shops. This trendy establishment offers a diverse range of options including clothing, beverages, and Asian cuisine among other attractions. However, it falls short in catering to celiac individuals as there is a lack of gluten-free items available.
name: Vila Container
address: Av. Gov Magalhães Barata, 62 - Nazaré, Belém - PA, 66060-281, Brazil

detail_description: The Teatro Estação Gasômetro is a beautiful and great performing arts theater. Unfortunately, the sound is not really the best.
name: Teatro Estação Gasômetro
address: Av. Gov Magalhães Barata, 830 - São Brás, Belém - PA, 66063-240, Brazil

name: Museum of Image and Sound
address: Av. Nª Sra. de Nazaré, 194 - Nazaré, Belém - PA, 66035-170, Brazil

detail_description: The Catholic church of São João Batista is renowned for its perfection. However, the disappointment was palpable during the festival. On the main day of the patron saint's party, attendees, including a family with a 5-month-old baby and her husband, were left standing as no chairs were provided. Despite numerous empty seats, people claimed they were reserving them for absent relatives or friends who never materialized. This incident tarnished an otherwise perfect image of the church and its festivities.
name: Church of Saint John the Baptist
address: R. João Diogo, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-280, Brazil

excerpt: 17th-century baroque church complex, home to a museum for religious paintings & decorative objects.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Belem, the St. Alexander Church - Museum of Sacred Art is a stunning example of 17th-century baroque architecture that has stood the test of time. This historic church complex not only serves as a place of worship but also houses an impressive museum showcasing religious paintings and decorative artifacts. Visitors can marvel at intricate sculptures crafted by indigenous artisans using local materials like cedar wood and plaster, reflecting the rich cultural heritage of the region.
name: St. Alexander Church - Museum of Sacred Art
address: Praça Frei Brandão, s/n - Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, 66020-240, Brazil

detail_description: There is an abundance of Catholics at Holy Trinity Parish, with a significant number of followers. The Catholic Church is the principal religious institution, consisting of devoted members who adhere to its teachings. The Holy Trinity Parish represents this community, which comprises a large congregation affiliated with the Catholic faith.
name: Holy Trinity Parish
address: Praça Barão do Rio Branco, 71 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66015-060, Brazil

name: Amazon Navigation Memorial
address: Cidade Velha, Belém - PA, Brazil

name: Museu de Anatomia
address: Av. Perimetral, 2-224 - Guamá, Belém - PA, 66075-110, Brazil

detail_description: The Teatro Maria Sylvia Nunes is a beautiful and fancy performing arts theater. It's very well-known for its amazing performances.
name: Maria Sylvia Nunes Theatre
address: Boulevard Castilhos França - s/n Dentro do Complexo da Estação das Docas, Campina, Belém - PA, 66010-020, Brazil

detail_description: The Arena Guilherme Paraense, also known as Mangueirinho, is a popular sports facility located in the local region. It adheres to all legal regulations and offers a wide range of services. Mangueirinho is widely recognized for its top-notch amenities and facilities that cater to various sporting activities. This complex has gained a reputation for being an excellent location for individuals looking to engage in sports or other recreational activities.
name: Arena Guilherme Paraense (Mangueirinho)
address: Rod. Augusto Montenegro, 524 - Castanheira, Belém - PA, 66635-924, Brazil

detail_description: Milton Trindade Square, also known as Horto Square or Praca do Horto, is a charming park located in the heart of Batista Campos, one of Belem's most verdant neighborhoods. This small yet picturesque square is a favorite among locals who often visit with their families to celebrate their children's birthdays using the complimentary kiosks available. In addition to this, the park offers a playground and ample space for walking.
name: Milton Trindade Square
address: R. dos Mundurucus, s/n - Batista Campos, Belém - PA, 66035-360, Brazil

detail_description: The Catholic church of St. Joseph, located in the neighborhood, includes a chapel dedicated to St. Benedict. It also has various programs such as classes for First Communion preparation and a course for newlyweds. The church staff is courteous and provides guidance on all aspects related to the church activities.
name: St. Joseph Church
address: R. Domingos Marreiros, 104 - Umarizal, Belém - PA, 66055-210, Brazil

detail_description: Casa Oiam is an impressive venue that offers a fantastic show, boasting a vibrant and joyful atmosphere. The place is filled with beautiful and relaxed individuals, creating a pleasant and informal ambiance. It serves as a hub for artistic expressions, providing ample space for exhibitions. Casa Oiam is undoubtedly a cultural center that showcases various forms of art in an engaging manner.
name: Casa Oiam
address: R. Arcipreste Manoel Teodoro, 616 - Campina, Belém - PA, 66015-040, Brazil
